alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 11:12PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Arthur, southwestern Cherry, Grant, northeastern Garden and southeastern Sheridan Counties through 1045 PM MDT... At 1011 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 21 miles northeast of Ellsworth to 13 miles south of Ashby. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hyannis, Ashby, Swan Lake, Duluth, Dipping Vat Meadow, Finnegan Lake, Swede Lake, Cogill Lake, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Mother Lake, Bingham, Green Lake, Dominick Lake, Pratt Lake and Spring Valley Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 128 and 158. Highway 61 between mile markers 136 and 194. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry
